infotexts.stasisbugequipconfirmation: Are you sure you want put stasis bag on yourself?
infotexts.bodybagequipconfirmation: Are you sure you want put a body bag on yourself?
infotexts.entitydescription.defib: A medical device delivering an electric shock to the heart to stabilize cardiac arythmias. Use on a patient with ventricular tachycardia or fibrillation.
infotexts.entitydescription.advscalpel: A tool used to make incisions during surgery.
infotexts.entitydescription.advhemostat: A tool used to clamp blood vessels during surgery.
infotexts.entitydescription.advretractors: A tool used to retract skin during surgery.
infotexts.entitydescription.ambubag: A bag valve mask (BVM), is a hand-held device commonly used to provide positive pressure ventilation to patients who are not breathing or not breathing adequately.
infotexts.entitydescription.autopulse: An automated, portable, battery-powered cardiopulmonary resuscitation device.
infotexts.entitydescription.ambubag: A bag valve mask (ambubag), is a hand-held device commonly used to provide positive pressure ventilation to patients who are not breathing or not breathing adequately.
infotexts.entitydescription.stasisbag: Stops biological processes and protects against cerebral hypoxia.
infotexts.entitydescription.bodybag: If the Europa is river Styx, your crewmate inside is a coin for Charon
infotexts.entitydescription.surgerysaw: A tool used to saw through bones.
infotexts.entitydescription.suture: Biodegradeable sutures for stitching up lacerations and surgical incisions alike.
infotexts.entitydescription.surgicaldrill: A tool used to drill bones.
infotexts.entitydescription.mannitol: A highly complicated and expensive medicinal compound which stimulates the regeneration of neurological tissue.
infotexts.entitydescription.osteosynthesisimplants: Titanium implants used in an open reduction surgery to repair fractures.
infotexts.entitydescription.operatingtable: A surgery table which has basic artificial ventilation built in.
infotexts.entitydescription.ointment: A highly antiseptic gel that promotes the recovery from burns as well as from minor infections.
infotexts.entitydescription.tweezers: A small tool that allows the removal of bullets as well as damaged and necrotic tissue.
infotexts.entitydescription.tourniquet: A device that applies pressure to a limb and thus reduces bloodflow. It is usually used in case of major bleeders on extremities.
infotexts.entitydescription.vialrack: Rack for storing test tubes and vials.
infotexts.entitydescription.bloodcollector: Empty blood collection cartridge, insert it inside «Blood Analyser»
infotexts.entitydescription.emptybloodpack: Just a sterile empty blood pack. What did you expect?
infotexts.entitydescription.antiseptic: A disinfectant used to disinfect the skin.
infotexts.entitydescription.antisepticspray: A device for directional spraying of antiseptic.
infotexts.entitydescription.propofol: Propofol, is a short-acting medication that results in a decreased level of consciousness and a lack of memory for events. Its uses include the starting and maintenance of general anesthesia.
infotexts.entitydescription.drainage: Is the drainage of lung secretions. It is used to treat a variety of conditions that cause the build-up of secretions in the lungs.
infotexts.entitydescription.armlock1: For some reason your right hand doesn't obey you. Something definitely needs to be done about this.
infotexts.entitydescription.armlock2: For some reason your left hand doesn't obey you. Something definitely needs to be done about this.
infotexts.entitydescription.needle: A needle with a decompression valve to make the air or liquid drain out of the pleural cavity or pericardium
infotexts.entitydescription.spinalimplant: Sends low levels of electricity directly into the spinal cord to relieve pain.
infotexts.entitydescription.reboa: is a procedure that involves placement of an endovascular balloon in the aorta to control bleeding, augment afterload and maintain blood pressure temporarily in traumatic hemorrhagic shock. reboa is considered a minimally-invasive alternative to thoracotomy with aortic cross-clamping.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.hypoxia: Patient is showing signs of nerve and brain damage.
infotexts.afflictioncauseofdeathself.hypoxia: You have died of Cerebral Hypoxia.

infotexts.afflictiondescription.fracture: One or more bones are broken and cause severe pain and locomotive issues.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.arterialcut: An artery has been damaged and is causing severe loss of blood.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.ll_arterialcut: An artery has been damaged and is causing severe loss of blood.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.rl_arterialcut: An artery has been damaged and is causing severe loss of blood.

infotexts.afflictiondescription.ra_arterialcut: An artery has been damaged and is causing severe loss of blood.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.t_arterialcut: MASSIVE bleeding due to rupture of aorta
infotexts.afflictiondescription.h_arterialcut: An artery has been damaged and is causing severe loss of blood.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.traumaticshock: The patient experiences severe pain and stress.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.anesthesia: The patient has drug-induced amnesia and sedation.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.necrosis: The tissues around the wound acquired a yellow-gray color and an sweet odor.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.sepsis: Infection made it into the bloodstream
infotexts.afflictiondescription.infectedwound: The injury is looking red and swollen.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.bandaged: Protective layers of bandaging material prevent the wound from getting infected.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.ointmented: A layer of antibiotic gel protects and cleans the wound from any germs.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.needlec: Normalizes the pressure in the pleural cavity
infotexts.afflictiondescription.coma: The patient is in a coma
infotexts.afflictiondescription.rupturedface: Face is severely damagedThe patient has problems with eating and speaking
infotexts.afflictiondescription.t_paralysis: The patient is paralyzed, and does not feel the body
infotexts.afflictiondescription.tamponade: As a result of a heart wound, blood accumulates in the pericardium and squeezes the heart
infotexts.afflictiondescription.pneumothorax: It is difficult for the patient to breathe, the sound of snow is heard when touching the chest
infotexts.afflictiondescription.afadrenaline: Increase in the tone of the body and pulse. Pain sensitivity is reduced
infotexts.afflictiondescription.afsaline: The volume of fluid in the circulatory system is temporarily restored
infotexts.afflictiondescription.hemotransfusionsho: The patient experiences mental agitation, vague anxiety. Constricting breath pains in the chest. shortness of breath, feeling of lack of air
infotexts.afflictiondescription.eventration: The content of abdomen comes out of the wound, it seems that the patient is not very pleased
infotexts.afflictiondescription.internalbleeding: The patient has blood loss and vomiting with blood
infotexts.afflictiondescription.severepain: Patient is experiencing acute severe pain
infotexts.afflictiondescription.lifesupport: The patient is helped to breathe by a ventilator built into the table
